key_points: O.J. Howard, a Tampa Bay Buccaneers player, missed most of the Super Bowl-winning season due to an Achilles rupture.
His recovery from the injury coincided with the birth of his daughter, Caliana Mia Howard, which helped him overcome the disappointment.
Despite his injury, Howard had been having the best start to a season in his career before getting hurt.
He recounted the moment of injury during a game against the Los Angeles Chargers, describing it as feeling like a kick on his leg.
Howard had a history of injuries but had taken extra steps in fitness and focus, especially with Tom Brady joining the team.
The birth of his daughter brought Howard joy and allowed him full-time parenting during his injury recovery.
He comes from a family-rich environment in Prattville, Ala., which has always been surrounded by children.
Howard appreciated the unique opportunity to be present during the early months of his daughter's life, unlike many athletes during the season.
He spent rehab time with Vita Vea, and though he missed playing, Howard found solace in his daughter and the team's success.
Howard is nearing the end of his rehab and looks forward to contributing to the team and making new memories with his daughter.
